docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 26. --Uruguayan exchange improved sharply today as a result of the announcement that the Bank of the Republic had been authorized to ship $5,000,000 gold, of which $3,000,000 would be used for service on the foreign debt in...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Aug. 26. --Uruguayan exchange improved sharply today as a result of the announcement that the Bank of the Republic had been authorized to ship $5,000,000 gold, of which $3,000,000 would be used for service on the foreign debt in September, October and November.
docs.abstract: Peso rises on news that Bank of the Republic would ship gold

headline.main: URUGUAY'S GOLD PLAN SENDS THE PESO UP; Announcement of Shipments Causes Quotation to Rise 3 Cents, to 48.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: BUSINESS WORLD; COMMERCIAL PAPER. August Trade Closing Poorly. Scope Latin-American Duty Rise. Dress Orders Gaining Volume. Appliques to Feature Swim Suits. Accessory Buying More Active. Furniture Trade Shows Spurt. Ask Larger China-ware Orders. Fall Shoe Call Heavier. Burlap Stronger on Foreign News. Gray Goods Market Stagnant.

docs.snippet: Organizes bur to boost league; sends delegation to Geneva
docs.abstract: Organizes bur to boost league; sends delegation to Geneva

headline.main: URUGUAY BOOSTS LEAGUE.; Bureau Set Up at Montevideo and Delegation Goes to Geneva.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Aug. 27.--The Uruguayan Government has so successfully wrapped up business and banking with official red tape and sundry carefully worded restrictive measures that international business is now paralyzed as completely as though the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Aug. 27.--The Uruguayan Government has so successfully wrapped up business and banking with official red tape and sundry carefully worded restrictive measures that international business is now paralyzed as completely as though the authorities had openly decreed a moratorium, a word whose use has been studiously avoided.
docs.abstract: Restrictions on foreign exch bring trade to standstill

headline.main: URUGUAYAN LAWS HURTING BUSINESS; Foreign Exchange Restrictions Have Effect of a Moratorium on Obligations Abroad. TARIFFS TO BE INCREASED Fifty Per Cent Rise Affecting Many American Products to Supplant Prohibition on Imports. Higher Duties Hit Us Hard.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES
Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Tariff law revisions effective Tuesday will increase duties on a wide variety of items imported into Chile and reduce taxes on others, according to the weekly survey issued yesterday by the Department of Commerce. The primary purpose of the revision...
docs.lead_paragraph: Tariff law revisions effective Tuesday will increase duties on a wide variety of items imported into Chile and reduce taxes on others, according to the weekly survey issued yesterday by the Department of Commerce. The primary purpose of the revision is to increase governmental revenues and to effect a more favorable trade balance.

headline.main: CHILE TARIFF SHIFTS TAKE EFFECT TUESDAY; Revisions on Imports Put Higher Taxes on Some Items-- Lowers Others.

docs.snippet: The more cheerful tone that had pervaded the bond market on the Stock Exchange in the previous few days continued during the short trading period yesterday. Further modest gains were scored by railroad bonds, which imparted a better tone to...
docs.lead_paragraph: The more cheerful tone that had pervaded the bond market on the Stock Exchange in the previous few days continued during the short trading period yesterday. Further modest gains were scored by railroad bonds, which imparted a better tone to industrial issues, and public utility issues...

headline.main: BOND PRICES FIRM ON STOCK EXCHANGE; Cheerful Tone Continues, With Modest Advances in Rails Strengthening Industrials. GAINS IN FOREIGN ISSUES Minor Irregularities Shown in German Group--British 5 s of1937 Up 1/8 Point.
